|postcode_area = PO |dial_code = 023 |os_grid_reference = SU563005 }} 'Lee-on-the-
Solent', often referred to as Lee-on-Solent, is a small seaside town in
Hampshire, England about five miles (8Â km) west of Portsmouth. The town is
located on the coast of the Solent and forms part of the borough of Gosport. It
is primarily a sleepy residential area, with an upsurge of mostly local visitors
in summer, but is well known as home to the Royal Naval Air Station HMS
''Daedalus'' (renamed as HMS Ariel from 1959 to 1965).
